00021 using namespace std;

00023 static const char Usage[] =
00024 "\n"
00025 "\n"
00026 "Usage: orcaroot [options] [input file(s) / socket host:port]\n"
00027 "\n"
00028 "The one required argument is either the name of a file to be processed or\n"
00029 "a host and port of a socket from which to read data. For a file, you may\n"
00030 "enter a series of files to be processed, or use a wildcard like \"file*.dat\"\n"
00031 "For a socket, the argument should be formatted as host:port.\n"
00032 "\n"
00033 "Available options:\n"
00034 "  --help : print this message and exit\n"
00035 "  --verbosity [verbosity] : set the severity/verbosity for the logger.\n"
00036 "    Choices are: debug, trace, routine, warning, error, and fatal.\n"
00037 "  --label [label] : use [label] as prefix for root output file name.\n"
00038 "  --keepalive [time] : keep a socket connection alive if lost.\n"
00039 "    Wait [time] (default 10) seconds between connection attempts.\n"
00040 "  --maxreconnect [num] : Maximum [num] socket reconnect attempts.\n"
00041 "    A [num] value of 0 sets this to infinity (i.e. no timeout).\n"
00042 "  --daemon [port] : Runs as a server accepting connections on [port]. \n" 
00043 "  --connections [num] : Maximum [num] connections accepted by server. \n" 
00044 "\n"
00045 "Example usage:\n"
00046 "orcaroot run194ecpu\n"
00047 "  Rootify local file run194ecpu with default verbosity, output file label, etc.\n"
00048 "orcaroot run*\n"
00049 "  Same as before, but run over all files beginning with \"run\".\n"
00050 "orcaroot --verbosity debug --label mylabel run194ecpu\n"
00051 "  The same, but with example usage of the verbosity and mylabel options.\n"
00052 "  An output file will be created with name mylabel_run194.root, and lots\n"
00053 "  of debugging output will appear.\n"
00054 "orcaroot 128.95.100.213:44666\n"
00055 "  Rootify orca stream on host 128.95.100.213, port 44666 with default verbosity,\n"
00056 "  output file label, etc.\n"
00057 "orcaroot --daemon 9090 --connections 10\n"
00058 "  Start orcaroot as a server on port 9090, accepting a maximum number of 10 connections.\n" 
00059 "\n"
00060 "\n";
00061 
00062 
00063 int main(int argc, char** argv)
00064 {
00065   if(argc == 1) {
00066     ORLog(kError) << "You must supply some options" << endl << Usage;
00067     return 1;
00068   }
00069 
00070 
00071   static struct option longOptions[] = {
00072     {"help", no_argument, 0, 'h'},
00073     {"verbosity", required_argument, 0, 'v'},
00074     {"label", required_argument, 0, 'l'},
00075     {"keepalive", optional_argument, 0, 'k'},
00076     {"maxreconnect", required_argument, 0, 'm'},
00077     {"daemon", required_argument, 0, 'd'},
00078     {"connections", required_argument, 0, 'c'}
00079   };
00080 
00081   string label = "OR";
00082   ORVReader* reader = NULL;
00083 
00084   bool keepAliveSocket = false;
00085   bool runAsDaemon = false;
00086   unsigned long timeToSleep = 10; //default sleep time for sockets.
00087   unsigned int reconnectAttempts = 0; // default reconnect tries for sockets.
00088   unsigned int portToListenOn = 0;
00089   unsigned int maxConnections = 5; // default connections accepted by server
00090 
00091   while(1) {
00092     char optId = getopt_long(argc, argv, "", longOptions, NULL);
00093     if(optId == -1) break;
00094     switch(optId) {
00095       case('h'): // help
00096         cout << Usage;
00097         return 0;
00098       case('v'): // verbosity
00099         if(strcmp(optarg, "debug") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kDebug);
00100         else if(strcmp(optarg, "trace") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kTrace);
00101         else if(strcmp(optarg, "routine") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kRoutine);
00102         else if(strcmp(optarg, "warning") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kWarning);
00103         else if(strcmp(optarg, "error") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kError);
00104         else if(strcmp(optarg, "fatal") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kFatal);
00105         else {
00106           ORLog(kWarning) << "Unknown verbosity setting " << optarg 
00107                           << "; using kRoutine" << endl;
00108           ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kRoutine);
00109         }
00110         break;
00111       case('l'): // label
00112         label = optarg;
00113         break;
00114       case('k'):
00115         if(!optarg) keepAliveSocket = true;
00116         else {
00117           keepAliveSocket = true;
00118           timeToSleep = abs(atol(optarg));
00119         }
00120         break;
00121       case('m'):
00122         reconnectAttempts = abs(atoi(optarg));
00123         break;
00124       case('d'):
00125         reconnectAttempts = 0;
00126         keepAliveSocket = false;
00127         runAsDaemon = true;
00128         portToListenOn = abs(atol(optarg));
00129         break;
00130       case('c'):
00131         maxConnections = abs(atoi(optarg));
00132         break;
00133       default: // unrecognized option
00134         ORLog(kError) << Usage;
00135         return 1;
00136     }
00137   }
00138 
00139   if (argc <= optind && !runAsDaemon) {
00140     ORLog(kError) << "You must supply a filename or socket host:port" << endl
00141                   << Usage << endl;
00142     return 1;
00143   }
00144 
00145   ORHandlerThread* handlerThread = new ORHandlerThread();
00146   handlerThread->StartThread();
00147   /***************************************************************************/
00148   /*   Running orcaroot as a daemon server. */
00149   /***************************************************************************/
00150   if (runAsDaemon) {
00151     /* Here we start listening on a socket for connections. */
00152     /* We are doing this very simply with a simple fork. Eventually want
00153        to check number of spawned processes, etc.  */
00154     ORLog(kRoutine) << "Running orcaroot as daemon on port: " << portToListenOn << endl;
00155     pid_t childpid = 0;
00156     std::set<pid_t> childPIDRecord;
00157     
00158     ORServer* server = new ORServer(portToListenOn);
00159     /* Starting server, binding to a port. */
00160     if (!server->IsValid()) {
00161       ORLog(kError) << "Error listening on port " << portToListenOn 
00162         << endl << "Error code: " << server->GetErrorCode() << endl;
00163       return 1;
00164     }
00165     while (1) {
00166       /* This while loop is broken by a kill signal which is well handled
00167        * by the server.  The kill signal will automatically propagate to the
00168        * children so we really don't have to worry about waiting for them to
00169        * die.  */
00170       while (childPIDRecord.size() >= maxConnections) { 
00171         /* We've reached our maximum number of child processes. */
00172         /* Wait for a process to end. */
00173         childpid = wait3(0, WUNTRACED, 0);
00174         if(childPIDRecord.erase(childpid) != 1) {
00175           /* Something really weird happened. */
00176           ORLog(kError) << "Ended child process " << childpid 
00177             << " not recognized!" << endl;
00178         }
00179       }
00180       while((childpid = wait3(0,WNOHANG,0)) > 0) {
00181         /* Cleaning up any children that may have ended.                   * 
00182          * This will just go straight through if no children have stopped. */
00183         if(childPIDRecord.erase(childpid) != 1) {
00184           /* Something really weird happened. */
00185           ORLog(kError) << "Ended child process " << childpid 
00186             << " not recognized!" << endl;
00187         }
00188       } 
00189       ORLog(kRoutine) << childPIDRecord.size()  << " connections running..." << endl;
00190       ORLog(kRoutine) << "Waiting for connection..." << endl;
00191       TSocket* sock = server->Accept(); 
00192       if (sock == (TSocket*) 0 || sock == (TSocket*) -1 ) {
00193         // There was an error, or the socket got closed .
00194         if (!server->IsValid()) return 0;
00195         continue;
00196       }
00197       if(!sock->IsValid()) {
00198         /* Invalid socket, cycle to wait. */
00199         delete sock;
00200         continue;
00201       }
00202       if ((childpid = fork()) == 0) {
00203         /* We are in the child process.  Set up reader and fire away. */
00204         delete server;
00205         delete handlerThread;
00206         handlerThread = new ORHandlerThread;
00207         handlerThread->StartThread();
00208         reader = new ORSocketReader(sock, true);
00209         /* Get out of the while loop */
00210         break;
00211       } 
00212       /* Parent process: wait for next connection. Close our descriptor. */
00213       ORLog(kRoutine) << "Connection accepted, child process begun with pid: " 
00214         << childpid << endl;
00215       childPIDRecord.insert(childpid);
00216       delete sock; 
00217     }
00218   /***************************************************************************/
00219   /*  End daemon server code.  */
00220   /***************************************************************************/
00221   } else {
00222     /* Normal running, either connecting to a server or reading in a file. */
00223     string readerArg = argv[optind];
00224     size_t iColon = readerArg.find(":");
00225     if (iColon == string::npos) {
00226       reader = new ORFileReader;
00227       for (int i=optind; i<argc; i++) {
00228         ((ORFileReader*) reader)->AddFileToProcess(argv[i]);
00229       }
00230     } else {
00231       reader = new ORSocketReader(readerArg.substr(0, iColon).c_str(), 
00232                                   atoi(readerArg.substr(iColon+1).c_str()));
00233       //((ORSocketReader*)reader)->SetKeepAlive(keepAliveSocket);
00234       //((ORSocketReader*)reader)->SetSleepTime(timeToSleep);
00235       //((ORSocketReader*)reader)->SetReconnectAttempts(reconnectAttempts);
00236       /*
00237       if(keepAliveSocket) {
00238         ostringstream tempString;
00239         tempString << reconnectAttempts;
00240         ORLog(kRoutine) << "Setting socket to stay alive: " << endl
00241           << "Sleep time: " << timeToSleep << " seconds" << endl
00242           << "Reconnect attempts: " 
00243           << ((reconnectAttempts == 0) ? "infinite" : tempString.str())
00244           << endl;
00245       }*/
00246     }
00247   }
00248   if (!reader->OKToRead()) {
00249     ORLog(kError) << "Reader couldn't read" << endl;
00250     return 1;
00251   }
00252 
00253   ORLog(kRoutine) << "Setting up data processing manager..." << endl;
00254   ORDataProcManager dataProcManager(reader);
00255 
00256   /* Declare processors here. */
00257   // ORMyProcessor processor;
00258   OROrcaRequestProcessor orcaReq;
00259   if (runAsDaemon) {
00260     /* Add them here if you wish to run them in daemon mode ( not likely ).*/
00261     dataProcManager.SetRunAsDaemon();
00262     dataProcManager.AddProcessor(&orcaReq);
00263   } else {
00264     /* Add the processors here to run them in normal mode. */
00265     // dataProcManager.AddProcessor(&processor);
00266   }
00267 
00268   ORLog(kRoutine) << "Start processing..." << endl;
00269   dataProcManager.ProcessDataStream();
00270   ORLog(kRoutine) << "Finished processing..." << endl;
00271 
00272   delete reader;
00273   delete handlerThread;
00274 
00275   return 0;
00276 }
